*Deomyinae *Gerbillinae *Lophiomyinae *Leimacomyinae *Murinae }} The 'Muridae'
are the largest family of mammals, containing over 700 species found naturally
throughout Eurasia, Africa, and Australia. They have been introduced worldwide.
The group includes true mice and rats, gerbils, and relatives.

The family name Muridae is sometimes used in a broader sense to include all
members of the superfamily Muroidea. The name comes from the Latin
{{lang|la|[[:wikt:mus|mus]]}} (genitive {{lang|la|[[:wikt:muris|muris]]}}),
meaning "mouse".
